segment.source: ResetConfig XML reference
segment.target: ResetConfig XML reference

segment.source: ResetConfig XML reference
segment.target: ResetConfig XML reference

segment.source: ResetConfig XML reference
segment.target: ResetConfig XML reference

segment.source: This reference describes all XML elements that are used to author the ResetConfig.xml file, used to configure Windows Recovery Environment push-button reset features.
segment.target: This reference describes all XML elements that are used to author the ResetConfig.xml file, used to configure Windows Recovery Environment push-button reset features.

segment.source: Reset
segment.target: Reset

segment.source: The XML element can contain the elements: and .
segment.target: The XML element can contain the elements: and .

segment.source: Run
segment.target: Run

segment.source: The XML element is used to add custom scripts to push-button reset features.
segment.target: The XML element is used to add custom scripts to push-button reset features.

segment.source: You can specify up to four elements in a single ResetConfig.xml file.
segment.target: You can specify up to four elements in a single ResetConfig.xml file.

segment.source: Each element must contain a different ExtPoint value for the attribute.
segment.target: Each element must contain a different ExtPoint value for the attribute.

segment.source: The following table describes the valid elements that can be added to the element:
segment.target: The following table describes the valid elements that can be added to the element:

segment.source: Element
segment.target: Element

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Each element defines the extensibility point to be used, the script that is executed at that extensibility point, and estimated time duration in minutes.
segment.target: Each element defines the extensibility point to be used, the script that is executed at that extensibility point, and estimated time duration in minutes.

segment.source: The attribute is required.
segment.target: The attribute is required.

segment.source: It accepts only the following values for [ExtPoint]:
segment.target: It accepts only the following values for [ExtPoint]:

segment.source: Runs the specified program at extensibility point A.
segment.target: Runs the specified program at extensibility point A.

segment.source: Runs the specified program at extensibility point B
segment.target: Runs the specified program at extensibility point B

segment.source: Runs the specified program at extensibility point C
segment.target: Runs the specified program at extensibility point C

segment.source: Runs the specified program at extensibility point D
segment.target: Runs the specified program at extensibility point D

segment.source: You can specify up to four sections in a single ResetConfig.xml file.
segment.target: You can specify up to four sections in a single ResetConfig.xml file.

segment.source: However, each section must contain a different value for the phase attribute.
segment.target: However, each section must contain a different value for the phase attribute.

segment.source: Specifies the location of the script for a particular section.
segment.target: Specifies the location of the script for a particular section.

segment.source: The path must be the relative path of the script from the folder which contains ResetConfig.xml (usually this is C:\Recovery\OEM).
segment.target: The path must be the relative path of the script from the folder which contains ResetConfig.xml (usually this is C:\Recovery\OEM).

segment.source: Specifies the estimated time, in minutes, that you expect the custom script to run.
segment.target: Specifies the estimated time, in minutes, that you expect the custom script to run.

segment.source: This estimate is used to display progress information in the GUI.
segment.target: This estimate is used to display progress information in the GUI.

segment.source: The duration must be an integer and must be between 1 and 5.
segment.target: The duration must be an integer and must be between 1 and 5.

segment.source: Specifies the command-line parameters to use when you run the custom script or executable file.
segment.target: Specifies the command-line parameters to use when you run the custom script or executable file.

segment.source: The value is treated as a string, and can contain multiple parameters.
segment.target: The value is treated as a string, and can contain multiple parameters.

segment.source: does not support empty elements.
segment.target: does not support empty elements.

segment.source: If your script does not require parameters, then do not include this element.
segment.target: If your script does not require parameters, then do not include this element.

segment.source: For examples, see Using ResetConfig.xml later in this topic.
segment.target: For examples, see Using ResetConfig.xml later in this topic.

segment.source: SystemDisk
segment.target: SystemDisk

segment.source: The element customizes bare metal recovery functionality.
segment.target: The element customizes bare metal recovery functionality.

segment.source: For more information, see Create Media to Run Push-Button Reset Features.
segment.target: For more information, see Create Media to Run Push-Button Reset Features.

segment.source: You can specify one section.
segment.target: You can specify one section.

segment.source: Here's the required and optional elements:
segment.target: Here's the required and optional elements:

segment.source: Element
segment.target: Element

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Required.
segment.target: Required.

segment.source: Specifies the minimum required size for the primary hard drive, in megabytes.
segment.target: Specifies the minimum required size for the primary hard drive, in megabytes.

segment.source: Bare metal recovery won't proceed if the system disk doesn't meet this size requirement.
segment.target: Bare metal recovery won't proceed if the system disk doesn't meet this size requirement.

segment.source: Required.
segment.target: Required.

segment.source: Path to Diskpart script relative to C:\Recovery\OEM.
segment.target: Path to Diskpart script relative to C:\Recovery\OEM.

segment.source: The script should assume that all existing partitions have been deleted, and the system disk has focus in Diskpart.
segment.target: The script should assume that all existing partitions have been deleted, and the system disk has focus in Diskpart.

segment.source: For example, if the recovery scripts are located at , use the value .
segment.target: For example, if the recovery scripts are located at , use the value .

segment.source: Required.
segment.target: Required.

segment.source: The partition to which the OS should be restored.
segment.target: The partition to which the OS should be restored.

segment.source: The ESP or active partition must be on the same disk as the OS.
segment.target: The ESP or active partition must be on the same disk as the OS.

segment.source: Optional.
segment.target: Optional.

segment.source: The index of the image within install.wim to be applied during bare metal recovery.
segment.target: The index of the image within install.wim to be applied during bare metal recovery.

segment.source: This element is optional and is only needed on manufacturer-created recovery media
segment.target: This element is optional and is only needed on manufacturer-created recovery media

segment.source: Optional.
segment.target: Optional.

segment.source: Specifies the partition where the Windows RE boot image is installed.
segment.target: Specifies the partition where the Windows RE boot image is installed.

segment.source: The and elements are optional, but they must be used together.
segment.target: The and elements are optional, but they must be used together.

segment.source: If only one of these elements is present, your user won't be able to repartition the hard drive.
segment.target: If only one of these elements is present, your user won't be able to repartition the hard drive.

segment.source: Optional.
segment.target: Optional.

segment.source: Specifies the folder path where the Winre.wim boot image is copied and staged, relative to the root of the partition specified in the element.
segment.target: Specifies the folder path where the Winre.wim boot image is copied and staged, relative to the root of the partition specified in the element.

segment.source: The and elements are optional, but they must be used together.
segment.target: The and elements are optional, but they must be used together.

segment.source: If only one of these elements is present, your user won't be able to repartition the hard drive.
segment.target: If only one of these elements is present, your user won't be able to repartition the hard drive.

segment.source: Optional.
segment.target: Optional.

segment.source: Specifies whether the recovery image should be applied with per-file compression enabled.
segment.target: Specifies whether the recovery image should be applied with per-file compression enabled.

segment.source: This element is optional and is only needed on manufacturer-created recovery media.
segment.target: This element is optional and is only needed on manufacturer-created recovery media.

segment.source: accepts the following values:
segment.target: accepts the following values:

segment.source: : Files applied from the image are compressed individually.
segment.target: : Files applied from the image are compressed individually.

segment.source: (default value): Compression is not used.
segment.target: (default value): Compression is not used.

segment.source: This setting is deprecated in Windows 10.
segment.target: This setting is deprecated in Windows 10.

segment.source: This setting is deprecated in Windows 10.
segment.target: This setting is deprecated in Windows 10.

segment.source: This setting is deprecated in Windows 10.
segment.target: This setting is deprecated in Windows 10.

segment.source: This setting is deprecated in Windows 10.
segment.target: This setting is deprecated in Windows 10.

segment.source: Using ResetConfig.xml
segment.target: Using ResetConfig.xml

segment.source: If you use a text editor to author your .xml files, you must save the document with an .xml file name extension, and use UTF-8 encoding.
segment.target: If you use a text editor to author your .xml files, you must save the document with an .xml file name extension, and use UTF-8 encoding.

segment.source: You must not use ANSI coding.
segment.target: You must not use ANSI coding.

segment.source: These files should be placed in the folder C:RecoveryOEM, and will automatically be detected by Push-button reset features.
segment.target: These files should be placed in the folder C:RecoveryOEM, and will automatically be detected by Push-button reset features.

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: This is a code example for the ResetConfig.xml file.
segment.target: This is a code example for the ResetConfig.xml file.
